monster.name: Alchemy Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
trait.text: If the alchemy golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The alchemy golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the alchemy golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to half the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The alchemy golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Monstrous Grafts
trait.text: The alchemy golem's weapon attacks, including monstrous grafts added by its creator, are magical. Monstrous grafts have a +6 attack bonus, deal twice the normal number of damage dice, and have a +5 bonus to their damage rolls. The alchemical golem can only have 1 graft in each slot.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The alchemy golem makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 43 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Death Snail

action.name: Leech
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description:
A death snail is formed from a vile concoction of forest troll bone meal, giant eagle blood, and goblin bone meal, enclosed in a hollowed-out efreet horn, and sealed shut with an ettercap tongue. The resulting monstrosity possesses a dull intelligence, but its only impulse is to slay all creatures other than its master.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 364 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Flying Book
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
trait.text: The flying book is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the flying book must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the flying book remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal book.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
Little can be said about the flying book that is not readily apparent. Though it is indistinguishable from an arcanist's spellbook while motionless, this animated arcane tome can flutter through the air at a moment's notice, using its cover as rudimentary wings. Flying books are playful and enjoy the sensation of being written in.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 364 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Fright
monster.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The fright can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.description:
Hauntings can often be attributed to the usual spectral suspects: ghosts, specters, shadows, and poltergeists. But benign hauntings, where a restless spirit merely plays tricks on the living, are usually caused by a fright. These spirits tend to be the artifacts of children or entertainers, clinging to the afterlife for company and a semblance of affection, and are as such preoccupied with fun. They never willingly harm others when they haunt a house, and they will serve any master that conjures them, if only for the sake of inclusion.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 365 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Grep
monster.languages: understands Common and Underdcommon but can't speak

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: The grep has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Keen Hearing And Smell
trait.text: The grep has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The grep can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Claw (Bonus Action)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description:
A grep is an underground scavenger, known for using its keen vision, acute hearing, and silent flight to trick and steal from travelers, hoarding its possessions in well-hidden troves. Arcanists use greps as messengers and scouts, but they excel as retrievers; a grep can be given the name of an important object and sent to find it, returning a short time later with its prize.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 365 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Mock

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The mock can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. It can only take the appearance of Tiny objects and prefers the form of gold coins and jewels. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
trait.text: The mock adheres to anything that touches it. A creature that picks up the mock can't drop it unless it succeeds on a DC 9 Strength check, made with disadvantage. The mock can only adhere to one creature at a time. The mock has advantage on attack rolls against any creature adhered to it.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
trait.text: While the mock remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage. If the mock is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

monster.description:
The diminutive relative of the mimic, the mock is a tiny shapechanger that replicates small, valuable objects to lure in its victims. In the desert, a mock might take the form of a canteen of precious water, and in a dungeon, it may replicate a sizable jewel or a spare gold piece. If an adventurer is caught by surprise, a mock is just as dangerous as its larger relatives, for it can hide in far less conspicuous places.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 366 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Moon Jelly

trait.name: Bioluminescence
trait.text: The moon jelly sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The moon jelly can only breathe underwater.

monster.description:
Though incapable of surviving on land, moon jellies are favored for their bioluminescence by witches that intend to explore deep underwater.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 366 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Pet Rock
monster.resist: fire, lightning, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, unconscious

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: The pet rock is indistinguishable from an ordinary rock with a face drawn on it.

trait.name: Just a Rock
trait.text: The pet rock counts as an object for the purposes of spells and magical effects. Additionally, the rock can't take actions that aren't specified in its statistics, and its speed can't be increased.

monster.description:
Widely considered to be the perfect familiar, requiring no food or water and possessing extremely high natural defenses, a pet rock can be conjured by most spellcasters. Though it doesn't act with any agility (indeed, it doesn't move at all), it can make a formidable weapon when thrown.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 367 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Rag Doll
monster.immune: poison, psychic, bludgeoning from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the rag doll remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal stuffed toy.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The rag doll can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 11 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Headbutt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
Crudely constructed but oddly endearing, rag dolls are constructs formed from children's toys, stuffed with soft material and adorned with smiling faces. Besides being generally comforting to have around, spellcasters favor rag dolls as familiars for their soft construction and inconspicuous nature; nobody questions a discarded doll, after all.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 367 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tin Soldier

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the tin soldier remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal toy.

trait.name: Formation
trait.text: The tin soldier has advantage on attack rolls when it is within 5 feet of another tin soldier.

action.name: Bayonet
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Rifle (recharge 6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Full of ticking clockwork, sprockets, and other gizmos, tin soldiers are mechanical creations fashioned by arcanists as servants and messengers. With some patience and skill, almost anyone can build a tin soldier, but spellcasters have long devised methods to conjure them wholesale from the Plane of Law's excess energies.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 368 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Winter Wolf Pup

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The pup has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description:
When fully grown, a winter wolf is an apex predator of the snow, a terror of teeth and fur, stalking the tundra in packs. But before they develop their fearsome freezing breath, winter wolf pups are far more amicable (perhaps because they have yet to realize the scope of their own might), and will dutifully follow a master that feeds them well and treats them with respect.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 368 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Yarn Golem

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the golem remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal ball of yarn.

trait.name: Mutable Form
trait.text: Whenever a spell or effect would alter the golem's form, the effect works as normal, except that the new form is always made out of a tangle of yarn.

action.name: Tangle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 12). The yarn golem can only grapple one creature at a time.

monster.description:
The greatest of golems are formed of clay, stone, and iron, but the least of them are constructed of yarn. Balled and sewn into a vaguely humanoid shape, yarn golems are among the first animated objects that arcanists learn to create, practicing with them obsessively until they master the basics and move onto more rigid materials. Yarn golems are friendly and playful, but risk foolishly unraveling themselves if they catch on sharp objects.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 368 (Homebrew)
